Description: Rim and body fragment of South Ionian Fikellura style pottery stemmed plate; interior, beige slip, frieze of alternating lotus buds and flowers, bordered by two bands at rim, painted in brownish paint; outside, light beige slip, two bands in faint brown-red paint.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Schlotzhauer 2012, p. 152-3 no. Nau 122, suggests production by Milesian workshops in the Hellespont, possibly at the Milesian colony of Abydos, citing a close parallel found at Berezan and attributed by clay analysis to Hans Mommsen's NAA group TROD.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 152-3, no. Nau 122, pl. 26, fig. g)
CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 10 no. 16, pl. 2 no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.166)
